Module org.example.eiscuno
Package org.example.eiscuno.model.game

Class GameUnoAdapter

java.lang.Object
org.example.eiscuno.model.game.GameUnoAdapter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, IGameUno
Direct Known Subclasses:
GameUno
public abstract class GameUnoAdapter extends Object implements IGameUno, Serializable
Abstract adapter class implementing the basic logic and rules of an UNO game.

This class provides core functionalities such as distributing cards, verifying if a card is playable, handling turn changes, managing the table state, and detecting game-ending conditions.

It acts as a base for the GameUno class, encapsulating shared logic while allowing specific game behaviors to be extended or modified.

See Also:

  • Method Details

    • startGame

      public void startGame() throws EmptyDeck
      Starts the Uno game.

      Each player is dealt 10 cards (first 5 to the human player, next 5 to the machine). The first card is then placed on the table.

      Specified by:
      startGame in interface IGameUno
      Throws:
      EmptyDeck - if the deck runs out of cards while dealing

    • isGameOver

      public GameStateEnum isGameOver()
      Checks if the game is over.
      Specified by:
      isGameOver in interface IGameUno
      Returns:
      0 if the game is not over, 1 if the deck is empty, 2 if the human player has played all his card or 3 if the machine player has played all his cards.
